examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.
Water will always find its own level.
She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
The court found in her favor.
words.defineEn: to randomly discover someone or something, particularly in a way that is surprising or unexpected
words.defineVi: để khám phá ngẫu nhiên một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là trong một cách đó là đáng ngạc nhiên hoặc bất ngờ

examples: The incident says an awful lot about his character.
The clock says ten past two.
His angry glance said it all.
To say a prayer.
The clock said three o'clock.
words.defineEn: to use words and our voice to show what we are thinking or feeling
words.defineVi: để sử dụng các từ và giọng nói của chúng tôi để hiển thị những gì chúng tôi đang suy nghĩ hoặc cảm thấy

examples: His face wore a puzzled look.
Both men wore confident smiles.
My mom wears facial mask sometmes.
The police officer wears a uniform and a badge.
He wears glasses now.
words.defineEn: to have something such as clothes, shoes, etc. on your body
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như quần áo, giày dép, vv trên cơ thể của bạn

examples: In case you’re now staring at your jewellery in horror, I should mention that silver metal in that bulky form is harmless.

Ravana then reveals his true form and swipes her, carrying her off in his flying chariot all Sita can do as she struggles is drop bits of her jewellery to a group of monkeys in the trees below Hoping that Rama will figure out what has happened.
words.defineEn: objects such as necklaces, bracelets or rings, typically made from gold, silver, etc. that we wear as decoration
words.defineVi: các đồ vật như dây chuyền, vòng tay hoặc nhẫn, thường được làm từ vàng, bạc, v.v. mà chúng ta đeo để trang trí

examples: Put your clothes in the cupboard.
She gave him presents and clothes.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
She received many compliments on her stylish clothes.
My clothes won't all go in that one suitcase.
words.defineEn: the things we wear to cover our body, such as pants, shirts, and jackets
words.defineVi: những thứ chúng ta mặc để che thân, chẳng hạn như quần, áo sơ mi và áo khoác

examples: The truck carried a load of construction materials to the building site.
The judge's ruling carries significant weight in the legal community.
She carries the heavy grocery bags with one arm.
He carries a gym bag with his workout clothes and water bottle.
She carried a heavy load of books in her backpack.
words.defineEn: to hold someone or something and take them from one place to another
words.defineVi: để giữ một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó và đưa họ từ nơi này sang nơi khác

examples: The bag broke under the weight of the bottles inside it.
My friend shared a bag of chocolate-covered macadamia nuts with us.
She put her bag on the table.
I left my bag downstairs in the entryway.
Each 180-litre container will hold up to three black bags of rubbish.
words.defineEn: something made of leather, cloth, plastic, or paper that we use to carry things in, particularly when we are traveling or shopping
words.defineVi: thứ gì đó làm bằng da, vải, nhựa hoặc giấy mà chúng ta dùng để đựng đồ, đặc biệt khi chúng ta đi du lịch hoặc mua sắm

examples: The baby had chubby cheeks and a cute face.
The baby cried its head off.
The baby has brought them great joy.
The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
words.defineEn: a child who is very young, usually too young to walk or speak
words.defineVi: một đứa trẻ còn rất nhỏ, thường còn quá nhỏ để đi hoặc nói

examples: Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
Which team won?
The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
Our team actually won!
words.defineEn: to become the most successful, the luckiest, or the best in a game, race, fight, etc.
words.defineVi: để trở thành người thành công nhất, may mắn nhất hoặc giỏi nhất trong một trò chơi, cuộc đua, cuộc chiến, v.v.

examples: The striped socks matched perfectly with his striped shirt.
Fifty thousand people saw the match.
The match was awesome.
He gave a good account of himself in matches against Crewe and Chesterfield.
They had a friendly soccer match with their friends in the park.
words.defineEn: a competition in which two players or teams compete against one another such as soccer, boxing, etc.
words.defineVi: một cuộc thi trong đó hai cầu thủ hoặc đội thi đấu với nhau như bóng đá, đấm bốc, v.v.

examples: Britain won five gold medals.
He won a gold medal in swimming at the national championship.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
The athlete was proud of her bronze medal, but she was determined to go one better and win gold at the next Olympics.
The Purple Heart, our nation's oldest military medal, is awarded to those service men and women who have borne the battle, sacrificing life and limb.
words.defineEn: a flat piece of metal, typically of the size and shape of a large coin, given to the winner of a competition or to someone who has done an act of bravery in war, etc.
words.defineVi: một miếng kim loại phẳng, thường có kích thước và hình dạng của một đồng xu lớn, được trao cho người chiến thắng trong một cuộc thi hoặc cho người đã thực hiện một hành động dũng cảm trong chiến tranh, v.v.

examples: No prizes for guessing what she was wearing.
The exceptional taste of Temple oranges makes them a prized ingredient in gourmet recipes.
There are hundreds of prizes up for grabs.
There are hundreds of prizes to be won.
He didn't get the prize he expected, but never mind - that's the way the ball bounces.
words.defineEn: anything that is given as a reward to someone who has done very good work or to the winner of a contest, game of chance, etc.
words.defineVi: bất cứ thứ gì được trao như một phần thưởng cho người đã làm rất tốt hoặc cho người chiến thắng trong một cuộc thi, trò chơi may rủi, v.v.

examples: He earned his money by the sweat of his brow.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
She earns money sitting for artists.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
Owing to legal changes, young barristers can no longer earn easy money on undefended divorces, which are now done by solicitors.
words.defineEn: to get money for the job that we do or services that we provide
words.defineVi: để có được tiền cho công việc mà chúng tôi làm hoặc dịch vụ mà chúng tôi cung cấp

examples: With Betty's salary they barely made ends meet.
I was living in cloud-cuckoo-land about my salary expectations.
He was able to negotiate a healthily high salary for his new job.
She had never been able to save much from her salary.
The software company was having trouble finding developers who could write quality code, but they were only offering salaries that were well below market rates.
words.defineEn: an amount of money we receive for doing our job, usually monthly
words.defineVi: một số tiền chúng tôi nhận được để thực hiện công việc của mình, thường là hàng tháng

examples: The business is losing money.
Money can't buy happiness.
Money means nothing to him.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
words.defineEn: something that people use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
words.defineVi: thứ mà mọi người sử dụng để mua và bán hàng hóa và dịch vụ, có thể ở dạng tiền xu hoặc hóa đơn giấy

examples: The professor knew his subject from the ground up.
I know my stuff.
I know this town like the back of my hand.
No one knows the answer.
She knows the score.
words.defineEn: to have some type of information about something or to be aware of something
words.defineVi: để có một số loại thông tin về một cái gì đó hoặc để nhận thức được một cái gì đó

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to come together in a place with others to do something special
words.defineVi: đến với nhau ở một nơi với những người khác để làm điều gì đó đặc biệt

examples: His family comes first.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
She dived head first into the water.
The horse took the first fence well.
words.defineEn: coming or happening before any other person or thing
words.defineVi: đến hoặc xảy ra trước bất kỳ người nào khác hoặc điều

examples: Things like this take time.
Time is moving on.
The time passed quickly.
Time to bust a move.
The contractor is really taking their time.
words.defineEn: the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
words.defineVi: số lượng được đo bằng giây, phút, giờ, v.v. bằng thiết bị như đồng hồ

examples: The clock said three o'clock.
Set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
She finishes her piano practice at 7 o'clock.
The restaurant reservation is for 8 o'clock tonight.
words.defineEn: put after the numbers one to twelve to show or tell what time it is, only when it is at that exact hour
words.defineVi: đặt sau các số từ một đến mười hai để hiển thị hoặc cho biết mấy giờ rồi, chỉ khi nó vào chính xác giờ đó

examples: He's hoping for an offer of compensation.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
I hope you have it on your conscience for the rest of your days!
I hope this letter reaches you.
I hope you've learned a lesson from this, Eddie.
words.defineEn: to want something to happen or be true
words.defineVi: để muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

examples: The food looks good.
Good wine can make a meal.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
This information is as good as gold.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is satisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng thỏa mãn

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
His new world record will take some beating.
The center will serve the whole community.
The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
A white blouse will show the blood.
words.defineEn: expressing the future tense
words.defineVi: diễn đạt thì tương lai

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.

The same thing happened to me.
Change doesn't happen overnight.
The door happened to be unlocked.
words.defineEn: to take place, particularly with no plan
words.defineVi: diễn ra, đặc biệt là không có kế hoạch

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
Does this pub do lunches?
Does the price include tax?
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
words.defineEn: to perform an action or activity that is not mentioned by name
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hành động hoặc hoạt động không được đề cập theo tên

words.phonetic: tə weɪt fɔːɹ ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to remain in a state of expectation or anticipation for something or someone
words.defineVi: để ở trong một trạng thái mong đợi hoặc dự đoán cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Buses take priority over other vehicles on the road.
The bus hit the bridge.
The bus can take 60 passengers.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
A bus appeared around the corner.
words.defineEn: a large vehicle that carries many passengers by road
words.defineVi: một chiếc xe lớn chở nhiều hành khách bằng đường bộ

words.defineEn: an extended duration of time that is typically longer than what is considered normal or expected
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian kéo dài thường dài hơn những gì được coi là bình thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: Watch your mouth!
The girls watched the development of this relationship with incredulity.
A large crowd watched the game on Saturday.
Watch your head on the low ceiling.
Watch me!
words.defineEn: to look at a thing or person and pay attention to it for some time
words.defineVi: để nhìn vào một điều hoặc người và chú ý đến nó trong một thời gian

examples: Cable TV reaches a huge audience.
The TV quiz was more fun than a barrel of monkeys!
The TV stays on all day in their house.
Millions of people followed the trial on TV.
She regularly appears on TV.
words.defineEn: an electronic device that shows images and videos and plays sounds and people use to watch different programs
words.defineVi: một thiết bị điện tử hiển thị hình ảnh và video và phát âm thanh và mọi người sử dụng để xem các chương trình khác nhau

examples: The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
The food looks good.
The garden looks nice.
Her father looked unhappy.
The house looks east.
words.defineEn: to have a particular appearance or give a particular impression
words.defineVi: để có một sự xuất hiện cụ thể hoặc cho một ấn tượng cụ thể

examples: I took a photo of the mountain peak, capturing its majestic beauty.
To take a picture/photo/shot of somebody/something.
I have a picture frame with a family photo on my desk.
The app lets you share your photos on Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr.
I need to update my passport photo.
words.defineEn: an image captured by a camera
words.defineVi: một hình ảnh được chụp bởi một máy ảnh

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling good
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tốt

words.defineEn: to resemble a thing or person in appearance
words.defineVi: để giống với một điều hoặc người xuất hiện

examples: The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.

My mother throws that far away.
This picture shows my mother as a young woman.
My mother has blue eyes and black hair.
words.defineEn: a child's female parent
words.defineVi: cha mẹ của một đứa trẻ

examples: The parent modeled good behavior by always wearing a seatbelt in the car, even for short trips.
Many young people look up to celebrities as role models.
The reforms served as a model for the rest of the Communist world.
The new smartphone model is currently the flavor of the week among tech enthusiasts.
The car manufacturer's latest model outperformed its competitors by a nose, offering slightly better fuel efficiency and a more comfortable ride.
words.defineEn: a person who is employed by an artist to pose for a painting, photograph, etc.
words.defineVi: một người được một nghệ sĩ thuê để tạo dáng cho một bức tranh, bức ảnh, v.v.

examples: He never missed a televised basketball or football game.
I missed the part where that's my problem.
but we missed them.
She received a missed call from an unknown phone number.
You've missed your mark three times in a row.
words.defineEn: to fail to catch a bus, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: không bắt được xe buýt, máy bay, v.v.

examples: This class is intense!
The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
Our next class will take the form of a debate.
The teacher withdrew the assignment from the class website.
The suite will add a touch of class to your bedroom.
words.defineEn: students as a whole that are taught together
words.defineVi: học sinh như một toàn thể được dạy cùng nhau

examples: That shot lost him the championship.
lose that creep!
His carelessness lost him the job.
The government has lost control of the city.
The business is losing money.
words.defineEn: to be deprived of or stop having someone or something
words.defineVi: bị tước đoạt hoặc ngừng có một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: a pair of lenses set in a frame that rests on the nose and ears, which we wear to see more clearly
words.defineVi: một cặp thấu kính được đặt trong một khung nằm trên mũi và tai mà chúng ta đeo để nhìn rõ hơn

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
The day brings a sense of vitality and liveliness to the world.
The bad weather brought famine.
The revolution brought many changes.
Retirement often brings with it a massive drop in income.
words.defineEn: to take someone or something to a place or to come to a place with someone or something
words.defineVi: đưa ai đó hoặc cái gì đó đến một nơi hoặc đến một nơi với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
See full dictionary entry for heart.
I bought a French dictionary to help me with my language studies.
I often use a dictionary to help me spell difficult words.
It seems only reasonable to ask students to buy a dictionary.
words.defineEn: a book or electronic resource that gives a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings, or gives the equivalent words in a different language
words.defineVi: một cuốn sách hoặc tài nguyên điện tử cung cấp danh sách các từ theo thứ tự bảng chữ cái và giải thích nghĩa của chúng hoặc đưa ra các từ tương đương trong một ngôn ngữ khác

examples: As I bit into the mombin, its fibrous texture and tropical taste brought back childhood memories.
Cherry pie is a classic dessert that brings back childhood memories of family gatherings.
The wintergreen candies bring back childhood memories for her.
The town tried for years to revive the old factory, but nothing they did brought back business.
Achilles brings back a Trojan woman from one battle.
words.defineEn: to make something or someone return or be returned
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó trả lại hoặc được trả lại

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
I'll always remember this holiday.
My favorite month is December because of the holidays.
We sometimes visit our relatives during the holidays.
words.defineEn: a period of recreation away from home or work
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian giải trí xa nhà hoặc nơi làm việc

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to reach for something and hold it
words.defineVi: để đạt được cho một cái gì đó và giữ nó

examples: The woman hit the mugger with her umbrella.
I forgot my umbrella, and now I'm getting wet in the rain.
I carried an umbrella with me because the weather looked cloudy.
Sorry, I forgot to bring my umbrella.
Don't forget to take your umbrella - it's raining cats and dogs out there.
words.defineEn: an object with a circular folding frame covered in cloth, used as protection against rain or hot sun
words.defineVi: một vật có khung gấp hình tròn được bọc vải, dùng để che mưa nắng

examples: Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.
The school took the full force of the explosion.
She left school at 16.
Many schools don’t take full advantage of the Internet.
The kids always work hard at school.
words.defineEn: a place where children learn things from teachers
words.defineVi: một nơi mà trẻ em học những điều từ giáo viên

examples: People are looking for ways to save money.
The president is looking for staff who will give him advice straight from the shoulder.
Are you still looking for a job?
We'll have to look for a better solution.
She is looking for a part-time job to earn extra money.
words.defineEn: to expect or hope for something
words.defineVi: để mong đợi hoặc hy vọng cho một cái gì đó

examples: "Sorry, I've run out."
Sorry, I'm still really groggy.
Sorry, what did you say?
Sorry, I don't follow.
Sorry, could you please hand me the book?
words.defineEn: feeling ashamed or sad about something that one has or has not done
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc buồn về điều gì đó mà một người đã hoặc chưa làm

examples: Hello, I'm new here.
Hello, it's good to see you again.
Hello, I am the new student and my name is Sarah.
She said hello to me and I went weak in the knees.
Come and say hello.
words.defineEn: a word we say when we see someone and want to greet them, or when we begin to talk on the phone
words.defineVi: một từ chúng ta nói khi nhìn thấy ai đó và muốn chào họ, hoặc khi chúng ta bắt đầu nói chuyện điện thoại

examples: The figures tell a different story.
To tell stories/jokes/lies.
She again told tales out of school.
Do tell me!
Tell me in words of one syllable!
words.defineEn: to use words and give someone information
words.defineVi: để sử dụng các từ và cung cấp cho ai đó thông tin

examples: Her jokes had us all in stitches.
At the charity event, the wealthy businessman's joke had everyone in stitches.
My friends all joked that I had a hollow leg.
You must be joking!’
He didn't see the joke.
words.defineEn: something a person says that is intended to make others laugh
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó một người nói rằng đó là nhằm làm cho người khác cười

examples: The city of Paris lies on the banks of the Seine River.
The witness was clearly lying through his teeth.
He lies like a rug.
I believed his lies for years.
To tell stories/jokes/lies.
words.defineEn: a statement that is false and used intentionally to deceive someone
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố đó là sai và sử dụng cố ý để đánh lừa một ai đó

examples: The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
A couple of years in the army should make a man of him.
Good wine can make a meal.
The news really made my day.
words.defineEn: to form, produce, or prepare something, by putting parts together or by combining materials
words.defineVi: để hình thành, sản xuất hoặc chuẩn bị một cái gì đó, bằng cách đặt các bộ phận lại với nhau hoặc bằng cách kết hợp các vật liệu

examples: My kids never misbehave when you watch them, so you definitely bring out the best in them!
Or, occasionally, they misbehave for some unknown reason.
They carried off the ones who misbehaved or cried too much.
Norse gods, like Greek ones, are all too human, and seem to misbehave accordingly.
Because my dad used to slap me on the bum if I misbehaved or shove me into my room hard enough that I've hit the floor.
words.defineEn: to act in an improper or unacceptable way
words.defineVi: để hành động trong một cách không phù hợp hoặc không thể chấp nhận

examples: The project failed for the want of adequate funding.
Words are failing me right now.
Her date failed to show.
The rise in turnover failed to add to the company's bottom line.
Politicians again failed to reach an agreement.
words.defineEn: to be unsuccessful in an examination or course
words.defineVi: không thành công trong một kỳ thi hoặc khóa học

examples: The days passed slowly.
The time passed quickly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Unemployment has now passed the three million mark.
words.defineEn: to get the necessary grades in an exam, test, course, etc.
words.defineVi: để đạt điểm cần thiết trong một kỳ thi, bài kiểm tra, khóa học, v.v.

examples: We need the results now.
She'll have had the results by now.
The result of this election is going to be too close to call.
The bakery incorporated finely diced fatback into savory pie crusts for flaky results.
If you invest time and energy into learning and personal growth, you will see positive results in your life.
words.defineEn: the final outcome or score of a competition, match, etc.
words.defineVi: kết quả hoặc tỷ số cuối cùng của một cuộc thi, trận đấu, v.v.

examples: The revised edition is to all intents and purposes a new book.
The scientist had to eat crow and revise their theory after new evidence contradicted their original findings.
The changes to the project didn't sit well with the team, so they decided to revise the plan.
Mark wasn't happy with his first draft of the book, but he's grateful for the chance to take a second bite at the cherry and revise it before submitting it to publishers.
The writing instructor told the students that whoever writes a book should be ready to accept criticism, and encouraged them to revise their work based on feedback from others.
words.defineEn: to make changes to something because of new information, etc.
words.defineVi: để thay đổi một cái gì đó vì thông tin mới, vv

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to study or be examined in a particular subject
words.defineVi: để nghiên cứu hoặc được kiểm tra trong một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: Lend an ear and listen to my version.
Can you lend me your red pen to fill out this form?
She lends her pencil to a classmate who forgot to bring one.
If Laura damages the car, her dad won't lend it to her again.
You'll lend him some, since you can afford to make ducks and drakes of it.
words.defineEn: to allow someone to have or use something that you own which must be returned to you later
words.defineVi: để cho phép ai đó có hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó mà bạn sở hữu mà phải được trả lại cho bạn sau này

examples: Eve borrows money to buy expensive designer clothes - champagne taste on a beer budget!
They can borrow them for as long as they need them.
My roommate asked me if she could borrow a zucchini to make a zucchini bread.
I decided to borrow a leaf out of his book and invest some money in the stock market.
I’ve got money you can borrow if you run out.
words.defineEn: to use or take something that someone else owns, which must be given back to them later on
words.defineVi: sử dụng hoặc lấy thứ gì đó mà người khác sở hữu, sau này phải trả lại cho họ

examples: I heard the tiny squeak of a mouse in the walls.
I hear the sound of seagulls near the sea.
To hear both sides of the argument.
The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
Have you heard the news?
words.defineEn: to notice the sound a person or thing is making
words.defineVi: để ý đến âm thanh mà một người hoặc vật đang tạo ra

examples: The closed window blocked out the noise from the street.
The dishwasher is making a strange noise.
The sudden noise made her start.
Local residents have raised concerns about late-night noise.
The constant noise from the construction site vexed the residents of the neighborhood.
words.defineEn: sounds that are usually unwanted or loud
words.defineVi: âm thanh thường không mong muốn hoặc lớn

examples: They were ringing my doorbell
That's my personal doorbell.
I don't have a Ring doorbell.
I use my cats as my personal doorbell.
And Google's Nest Hello video doorbell starts at $229.
words.defineEn: a bell operated by a button outside a house or apartment that makes a sound when pushed, particularly to inform the inhabitants inside
words.defineVi: một cái chuông được vận hành bởi một nút bên ngoài một ngôi nhà hoặc căn hộ phát ra âm thanh khi được đẩy, đặc biệt là để thông báo cho những người ở bên trong

words.defineEn: to receive and pay attention to sounds with the ears, often with the intention of understanding or gaining information
words.defineVi: tiếp nhận và chú ý đến âm thanh bằng tai, thường với ý định hiểu hoặc thu thập thông tin

examples: Can you read music?
The music was far too loud for my liking.
Her words were music to my ears.
Set this poem to music.
That music really gets me.
words.defineEn: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices, arranged in a way that is pleasant or exciting to listen to
words.defineVi: một loạt âm thanh được tạo ra bởi các nhạc cụ hoặc giọng nói, được sắp xếp theo cách dễ chịu hoặc thú vị để nghe

examples: The bedside radio played softly.
The rebels held the radio station.
They're always playing that song on the radio.
Did you hear that play on the radio last night?
Even if they weren't televised, he was glued to the radio.
words.defineEn: a device that is used for listening to programs that are broadcast
words.defineVi: một thiết bị được sử dụng để nghe các chương trình được phát sóng
